item.title: Climate change: UN to reveal landmark IPCC report findings
item.description: The report will be a "massive wake-up call" to governments to cut emissions, environmental experts say.

item.title: Greece wildfires: Strong winds push flames towards villages
item.description: Greece is experiencing its most severe heatwave in 30 years with temperatures reaching 45C (113F).

item.title: Covid: Virus 'still with us' as Scotland exits level zero
item.description: Physical distancing ends in most settings, nightclubs reopen and limits on gatherings are removed.

item.title: Dixie Fire: Firefighters tackles historic California wildfire
item.description: The Dixie Fire has burned through more than 463,000 acres and could take weeks to extinguish.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban capture three regional capitals
item.description: Three cities, including the strategically important Kunduz, fall to the militant group in a single day.

item.title: Thailand man charged over death of Swiss tourist near waterfall
item.description: The 27-year-old man has been charged with murdering the 57-year-old woman.

item.title: St Jude Invitational: Kim Si-woo finds water five times on one hole to score 13 on par three
item.description: Finding water five times on one hole saw South Korea's Kim Si-woo score 13 on a par three to record the highest score on the PGA Tour since 1983.

item.title: Tobacco giant Philip Morris raises bid for respiratory drugmaker
item.description: Philip Morris is seeking to buy Vectura, which makes treatments for diseases such as asthma.

item.title: A-level results: Students have been treated fairly - watchdog
item.description: The head of the exams regulator defends the system for deciding grades ahead of A-level and GCSE results day.

item.title: Heart surgery waits in England may rise by 40%, warns charity
item.description: Even before Covid, waits for heart treatment were far too long, the British Heart Foundation says.

item.title: Joe Willock: Newcastle agree deal to sign Arsenal midfielder for more than £20m
item.description: Newcastle agree a fee with Arsenal in excess of £20m to sign midfielder Joe Willock.

item.title: Covid PCR costs can be excessive and exploitative, says Javid
item.description: The health secretary calls on a watchdog to investigate "exploitative" firms overcharging holidaymakers.

item.title: The Papers: Praise for GB heroes, and push for office return
item.description: Britain's Olympic medal haul features on many of Monday's newspaper front pages.

item.title: How A Level and GCSE results are calculated
item.description: Education correspondent Branwen Jefferys explains how grades are calculated and how you can appeal.

item.title: Greece wildfires: 'It's like a horror movie but it's real life'
item.description: Thousands of people have had to evacuate Greece's second biggest island as severe wildfires rage.

item.title: ‘Parkinson’s doesn't stop me playing tennis’
item.description: Andy Wright, who was diagnosed at 33, says his return to the sport helps alleviate symptoms.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Relive some of the best bits from the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games
item.description: Relive some of the best bits from the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games, including brilliant skills, gold medal moments and world records.

item.title: Why is gold so important for British Asians?
item.description: A new podcast explores why gold has symbolic and historical significance for British Asians.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 21 striking photographs from the Olympic Games
item.description: A selection of 21 of the most striking photographs taken from Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Part of 'Banksy' artwork near Lowestoft removed over flood fears
item.description: A small, metal "boat" under a painting of three children was taken away by contractors, a council says.

item.title: Malta: The teenagers pulled from the sea and accused of terrorism
item.description: How three teenagers rescued from the Mediterranean Sea ended up in Malta accused of terrorism.

item.title: Why China's climate policy matters to us all
item.description: The global battle against climate change is likely to be won or lost in China.

item.title: A-levels 2021: When do results come out?
item.description: For the second year running, pupils in England, Wales and Northern Ireland have not taken the exams.

item.title: Children's home fire: 'The souls of our daughters are still there'
item.description: The mothers of teenage girls who died in a 2017 fire at a children's home in Guatemala want justice.

item.title: Assam-Mizoram clash: 'It was like a war between two countries'
item.description: A long-running border dispute is affecting relations between two neighbouring Indian states.

item.title: Same-sex parents battle for inclusive paperwork for baby
item.description: Kate and Gemma Fox have encountered numerous forms they cannot fill in since the birth of their son.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: A look at how Team GB fared sport-by-sport compared to their funding.
item.description: How Great Britain fared sport-by-sport at the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games relative to their funding.

item.title: Can technology help authors write a book?
item.description: Writing a novel is notoriously difficult, but technology may give the writer a helping hand.

item.title: Covid in Sydney: Communities feel under siege as troops deployed
item.description: Residents say they're being treated like second-class citizens to stem a Covid outbreak.

item.title: Saka clapped by Spurs fans on Arsenal return; Robertson injured in Liverpool draw
item.description: Tottenham fans applaud Arsenal's Bukayo Saka on to the pitch on his first appearance since Euro 2020.

item.title: Roy inspires Invincibles to Hundred win over Rockets
item.description: Jason Roy thrills the home crowd to inspire Oval Invincibles to a nine-run victory over top-of-the-table Trent Rockets in a rain-shortened men's Hundred match.

item.title: Messi set for PSG medical before Eiffel Tower unveiling - Monday's gossip
item.description: Lionel Messi is set to have a medical on Monday before a move to Paris St-Germain, Arsenal are ready to make a bid for Kieran Trippier, plus more.

item.title: Team GB match London 2012 medal haul as Kenny and Price take gold - what's happened on the final day?
item.description: Cyclist Jason Kenny's keirin triumph plus boxing gold for Lauren Price mean Team GB's Tokyo Olympics medal haul of 65 matches London 2012's total.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Relive every Team GB gold medal at 2020 Games
item.description: Watch every Team GB gold medal at Tokyo 2020 including history for Jason Kenny and a brilliant BMX display by Charlotte Worthington.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules across the UK?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: ‘Covid passports’: How to get the NHS Covid Pass
item.description: People in England can use the pass for travel and to visit venues which ask for them.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government is expected to announce that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government has updated its red, amber and green lists of countries.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid: When will teenagers get the jab and do I need a booster?
item.description: More teenagers will be able to receive the Covid vaccine, and a third jab will soon be available for the most vulnerable.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: The number of people pinged by the Covid app has fallen significantly.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: What are the Delta, Gamma, Beta and Alpha Covid variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: ‘I'm black, my partner's white - stop asking me if this is my baby’
item.description: When Ena Miller had a baby, she was unprepared for the constant comments about her daughter's skin tone.

item.title: Yami 'Rowdy' Lofvenberg: The top hip-hop dancer who can’t count the beats
item.description: Dancer Yami "Rowdy" Lofvenberg was labelled "stupid" at school. Now she has returned to education - as a lecturer.

item.title: Tom Daley: The boy with the Olympic dream that came true
item.description: The 'baby' of Beijing became a father, a husband and an LGBTQ+ spokesperson. And now Tom Daley is an Olympic gold medallist. This is his story.

item.title: Trading sex for cosmetic surgery in Mexico's narco capital
item.description: The influence of narcos has caused many women to undergo cosmetic surgery in Mexico's Sinaloa state.

item.title: Cocaine in the UK: The DJ and friends helping addicts beat their 'beasts'
item.description: More people in the UK are taking cocaine. A DJ and ex-addict in Liverpool is helping them stop.
